job_title: Child and Youth Worker in Toronto, ON
pros: There is a lot of potential to build individual relationships with the residents which is critical for staff and youth. There is little structure regarding programming and enforcing rules; which can give opportunities for creative and spontaneous activities for the residents.
cons:
The unspoken program mantra is "limitations"; which is practiced quite frequently.  Those who's skills include creating an adaptive environment, will not flourish. This program thrives on fostering conflict between individuals experiencing high levels of stress, aggressive personalities, etc. Senior staff often fail to identify obvious situations that pose imminent risk of danger. 

The lack of fluidity between staff regarding what rules are enforced and their varying consequences, often confuse residents which often results in disregarding house rules, hostile behaviour towards staff, and little structure.
